definition: The simulated actual rate node allows setting a specific rate value for the simulation of each order, overriding the slippage parameter of the trading session.

paragraphs.text: How the Simulated Actual Rate Works

The slippage parameter of the trading session allows setting a blanket slippage for all orders in the trading system. The simulated actual rate node allows control on a per-order basis, so each order may be simulated with a specific rate.
If the node is not present or the parameter is undefined, the slippage parameter set up for the trading session is used.
To add the simulated actual rate node, select Add Missing Items on the parent node menu.
